Package suga.engine.physics.collidables

Class ElasticCollider

java.lang.Object
suga.engine.physics.collidables.ElasticCollider
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collidable, Physical
public class ElasticCollider extends Object implements Collidable
An ElasticCollider is a collider which results in perfectly elastic collisions.

  • Constructor Details

    • ElasticCollider

      public ElasticCollider(Vector pos, Vector vel, Vector accel, double mass, HitBox hitBox)
      Creates a new ElasticCollider with the given position, velocity, acceleration, mass, and HitBox.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position of this ElasticCollider.
      vel - The velocity of this ElasticCollider.
      accel - The acceleration of this ElasticCollider.
      mass - The mass of this ElasticCollider.
      hitBox - The hitBox that should be used by this ElasticCollider.

    • clone

      public ElasticCollider clone()
      Returns a deep copy of this collidable object. Used to preserve values of velocity, position, and acceleration during collision calculations.
      Specified by:
      clone in interface Collidable
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Two ElasticColliders are equal if the fields are the same.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to check if it is equal to 'this'.
      Returns:
      True if and only if the two objects are equivalent. Two objects are equivalent if field values are the same even if they don't share objects.
